result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin John Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Burnett County Cases 22CT7 and 22CF129

miscConds.notes:
1) The court assessed only the DNA surcharge and waived all other court costs in this matter. 
2) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
3) All costs, fees, and other surcharges have been paid in full from the bond funds posted in this matter.
No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

The defendant shall obtain a valid driver's license. 

Burnett County Cases 22TR436 and 22TR437 were DRI.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin John Anderson

records.addlTxt:
1:50 PM Cases 22CF129, 22CF139, 22CT7, 22TR436, and 22TR437 called together.  Defendant Benjamin John Anderson in court.  Attorney Daniel P Repka appeared by video for Benjamin John Anderson.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Off the record 1:50 PM.  Back on the record 1:53 PM, same appearances- except Atty Repka now appears via audio only due to technical difficulties.  Def stipulates to appearances as they are today, waives all in person hearing KIV. Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Off the record 1:55 PM.  Back on the record, 1:56 PM, same appearances as previously noted- except now Atty Repka appears telephonically.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Repka: def is pleading to Ct 1: OAR in 22CT07, Ct 3: possession of drug paraphernalia in 22CF129, and Ct 2: OAR in 22CF139; parties jointly recommending 1 year probation, withheld in 22CT7 and 22CF139; def must get a valid license while on probation; in 22CF129, recommendation of costs-only.  Def has jail credit, parties to file jail credit figure within 1 week.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for pleas. 
 Def enters pleas of Guilty.  Court finds def is making pleas knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Ct 1 of 22CT07, Ct 3 of 22CF129, and Ct 2 of 22CF139 and orders a JOC; remaining counts and cases are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def does not make a statement to the Court. 
Court orders:
Ct 1 of 22CT07- OAR: 1 yr probation; 4 months jail imposed/stayed $350
Ct 2 of 22CF139- OAR: 1 yr probation; 4 months imposed/stayed $200 DNA
Ct 3 of 22CF129- Possession of drug paraphernalia: 1 yr probation; 4 months imposed/stayed $200 DNA; all sentences concurrent
Conditions of probation:
Bond to be applied to pay these fines off in full.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Obtain a valid driver's license.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.

Adjustment Number: 22A 019777,
Payable Number: 77892,
Receipt Number: 22R 004916,
Amount: $20.00
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

10:55 AM Cases 22CF129, 2022CF000139, 2022CT000007, 2022TR000436, and 2022TR000437 called together.  Defendant Benjamin John Anderson appeared by phone.  Attorney Daniel P Repka appeared by video for Benjamin John Anderson.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Cases on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: global resolution has been reached, needs plea/sentencing; agreement is for def to plead G to 2 OARs and a Drug paraphernalia charge, 1 yr probation on OARs (for def to get license) and costs only on the paraphernalia charge.  Court requires in-person for def for next hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 10:45 am.

10:35 AM Cases 22CF129, 2022CF000139, 2022CT000007, 2022TR000436, and 2022TR000437 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin John Anderson appeared by phone.  Attorney Daniel P Repka appeared by video for Benjamin John Anderson. Cases 22CF129 and 22CF139 on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of informations, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:45 am.

3:14 PM Cases 22CF129, 2022CF000139, 2022CT000007, 2022TR000436, and 2022TR000437.Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin John Anderson appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel P Repka appeared by video for Benjamin John Anderson. Atty Repka states the prelim will be waived.  Cases 22CF129 and 22CF139 proceed to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files informations mirroring complaints.  Bond continues.
Arraignment scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

3:22 PM Cases 22CF129, 22CF139, 22CT7, 22TR436, and 22TR437 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin John Anderson appeared by phone.  Attorney Daniel P Repka appeared by phone for Benjamin John Anderson.  TR matters on for intake- def enters NG pleas. Cases 22CF129, 22CF139, and 22CT7 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaints in 22CF129 and 22CT7 (but 139 was filed today), waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Upon request of def, court reviews the charges for 22CF139 and proceeds with initial appearance in that case as well.  NG pleas entered to misdemeanors.  WTLPH.  If prelims are to be waived, Zoom is approved for all parties.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Letter from DA re: Copy of summons and complaint to defendant
Further proceedings on June 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:06 PM Cases 22CF129, 22CT7, and 22GF143 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin John Anderson in court w/atty Daniel Repka appearing via Zoom video.  Atty Repka requests adjournment.  Discussion of def's driver's license.  Atty Repka asks to hold off on filing the charges in 22GF143 until the attorneys have a discussion.  DA amenable to that, if it's not already done.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

This bond covers cases 22CF129 and 22GF143.  Defendant must post an additional $250 to be released.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.  The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
